CIPHER.97.cipherString: Could it be that some place out there in the computational universe, we might find our physical universe?
CIPHER.97.question: A quote by Stephen Wolfram has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.97.author: Stephen Wolfram

CIPHER.94.cipherString: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
CIPHER.94.question: The following quote by Epictetus needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of LURES
CIPHER.94.author: Epictetus

CIPHER.78.cipherString: To me, thee greatest lpeasure of writign si not hwat its about, ubt the inner umsic that words make.
CIPHER.78.question: A friend of yours tried to encode a quote by Truman Capote as an Aristocrat using a K2 alphabet.  However they turn out to be a terrible speller and typist.  What did they encode?
CIPHER.78.author: Truman Capote

CIPHER.80.cipherString: The progressive development of man is vitally dependent on invention.
CIPHER.80.question: The following quote by Nikola Tesla needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of EQUAL and polybius key of UNSCRIPTED.
CIPHER.80.author: Nikola Tesla

CIPHER.95.cipherString: We tend to think of technological progress as an ever accelerating affair, but it just isn't so.
CIPHER.95.question: A quote by William J. Bernstein has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told that the second word decodes to TEND
CIPHER.95.author: William J. Bernstein

CIPHER.75.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 94021735 2698. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.83.cipherString: There is only one way to success, wealth and achievement and that is through a lot of hard work.
CIPHER.83.question: A quote by John Patrick Hickey has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. What was the K2 Keyword used to encode it?
CIPHER.83.author: John Patrick Hickey

CIPHER.84.cipherString: Space or science fiction has become a dialect for our time.
CIPHER.84.question: The following symbols encode a quote by Doris Lessing using a Baconian cipher
CIPHER.84.author: Doris Lessing

CIPHER.96.cipherString: To Achieve What Nobody Else Has, You Must Do What Nobody Else Does
CIPHER.96.question: Some advice which has MUSTDO somewhere in it has been encoded using the Complete Columnar Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.96.author: Anonymous

CIPHER.81.question: Decode the following quote by Gaelic Proverb which was encoded as a 2x2 Hill Cipher using a keyword of ARTS.
CIPHER.81.author: Gaelic Proverb

CIPHER.79.cipherString: Gratitude is merely the secret hope of further favors.
CIPHER.79.question: The following symbols encode a quote by Francois de La Rochefoucauld using a Baconian cipher
CIPHER.79.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

CIPHER.82.cipherString: Man little knows what calamities are beyond his patience to bear till he tries them.
CIPHER.82.question: The following quote by Oliver Goldsmith needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of BUSILY and polybius key of STUMBLING.
CIPHER.82.author: Oliver Goldsmith

CIPHER.76.cipherString: A nice box of chocolates provide your total daily intake of calories in one place. Isn't that handy?
CIPHER.76.question: An observation has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. What was the K1 Keyword used to encode it?
CIPHER.76.author: Unknown

CIPHER.90.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 569 461261 8703 . What do they decode to?

CIPHER.77.cipherString: A smile is the light in your window that tells others that there is a caring, sharing person inside.
CIPHER.77.question: A quote by Denis Waitley has been encoded using the Complete Columnar Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has TELLS somewhere in it.
CIPHER.77.author: Denis Waitley

CIPHER.87.cipherString: Nothing is less in our power than the heart, and, far from commanding it, we are forced to obey it.
CIPHER.87.question: A quote by Rousseau has been encoded using the K3 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. What was the K3 Keyword used to encode it?
CIPHER.87.author: Rousseau

CIPHER.88.question: Decode the following French Proverb which was encoded as a 2x2 Hill Cipher using a keyword of TOUT.
CIPHER.88.author: French Proverb

CIPHER.89.cipherString: La expresión por sí sola puede investir a la belleza con un dominio supremo y duradero sobre el ojo.
CIPHER.89.question: A quote by Fuseli in Spanish has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. It has been encoded using a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.
CIPHER.89.author: Fuseli
CIPHER.89.translation: Expression alone can invest beauty with supreme and lasting command over the eye.

CIPHER.92.cipherString: Wisdom becomes flawed when knowledge is in the wrong hands.
CIPHER.92.question: A quote by Anthony T. Hincks has been encoded using the Fractionated Morse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote starts with WISDOM.
CIPHER.92.author: Anthony T. Hincks

CIPHER.85.cipherString: Ethics is doing the right thing when no one is watching, especially when you think no one ever will.
CIPHER.85.question: A quote by Kuruvilla Pandikattu has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.85.author: Kuruvilla Pandikattu

CIPHER.86.cipherString: Discipline yourself and others won't need to.
CIPHER.86.question: The following strange headlines encode a quote by John Wooden using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the deciphered text starts with DISC
CIPHER.86.author: John Wooden

CIPHER.93.cipherString: Unwinding a habit that you have allowed to entangle you can be difficult. But the power is in you. Do not despair.
CIPHER.93.question: A quote by Boyd K. Packer has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.93.author: Boyd K. Packer

CIPHER.91.cipherString: Knowledge was like candy: you never turned it down, especially if you didn't have to work too hard to get it.
CIPHER.91.question: A quote by Robert Liparulo has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.91.author: Robert Liparulo
